block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of 50-day cash management bills on Tuesday.
According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.50 percent, and the rate on the six-month issue was 6.08 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of 50-day cash management bills on Tuesday.
According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.50 percent, and the rate on the six-month issue was 6.08 percent.
No taxable fixed-income issues are scheduled this week, but the following tax-exempt offerings are:
TAX EXEMPT TUESDAY
Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, $200 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, $300 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
South Carolina Transportation, $268.8 million of revenue bonds. Competitive. Wisconsin, $200 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Forest Hills, Mich., Public Schools, $122.3 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Mississippi, $202.3 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Alaska Housing Finance Corporation, $170 million of single-family bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Chicago Park District, $67 million of harbor facilities revenue bonds. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Grand Rapids, Mich., $90.8 million in water supply refunding revenue bonds. Standard Capital Markets.
University of Denver, $52.7 million of educational and cultural facilities authority revenue bonds. A. G. Edwards & Sons.
DeKalb County, Ga., $210 million of water and sewer revenue bonds. Salomon Smith Barney.
Indiana Health Facility for Clarion Health, $125 million of general obligation bonds.
Hawaii Electric Authority, $60 million of general obligation bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Kansas Transportation Department, $150 million of highway revenue bonds. Salomon Smith Barney.
Ohio, $120 million of general obligation bonds. PaineWebber.
Philadelphia Schools, $135 million of general obligation bonds. PaineWebber.
Trustees of the Tulsa, Okla., Municipal Airport, $180 million of trust revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
